intro: Gymnadenia rubra var. dolomitensis, commonly known as the Dolomite red gentian, is a rare and striking plant native to specific alpine regions in Europe. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which bloom in late summer, and its preference for calcareous soils. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and meadows. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue or red flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
